alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Telfair; Wilcox (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 02 at 10:07PM EDT until April 07 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River at Abbeville affecting Wilcox, Telfair and Dodge Counties. Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville affecting Pulaski and Bleckley Counties. Oconee River near Mount Vernon affecting Wheeler, Montgomery and Treutlen Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River at Dublin affecting Laurens, Johnson, Wilkinson and Washington Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, Juliette, Dames Ferry, Macon, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River at Abbeville. * WHEN...Until late Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 16 feet, Flooding of farm lands...timberlands...and access roads will occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 16 feet and slowly falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 PM EDT Sunday was 16.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Friday afternoon and continue falling to 11.9 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 12 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
